com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin

Class GeneiousService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.GeneiousService
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DatabaseService, GeneiousServiceWithPanel

    public abstract class GeneiousService
extends Object
    A service provides a piece of functionality for the Geneious system. The most obvious service is a database service (DatabaseService and friends), but other types of services are possible, even though the public API has not finalized details on all of them. All methods below that return lists are allowed to return an empty list (e.g. Collections.emptyList()) but not null.

    A plugin may provide a set of services via GeneiousPlugin.getServices(). The following is an example of a GeneiousService as an anonymous inner class: 

     new GeneiousService[]{
                        new DatabaseService(){
                                public String getUniqueID() {
                                        return "SampleService";
                                }

                                public String getName() {
                                        return "Empty Service";
                                }

                                public String getDescription() {
                                        return "An empty service";
                                }

                                public String getHelp() {
                                        return "Help with the service!";
                                }

                                public Icons getIcons() {
                                        return null;
                                }

                                public QueryField[] getSearchFields() {
                                        return new QueryField[]{
                                                new QueryField(new DocumentField("Name","The sequence name","name",String.class,false,false),new Condition[]{Condition.CONTAINS}),
                                                new QueryField(new DocumentField("Residues","The sequence residues","residues",String.class,false,false),new Condition[]{Condition.CONTAINS})
                                        };
                                }

                File fasta = new File(pluginDir.getAbsolutePath()+File.separator+"sampledb.fasta");

                //we find results based on the given query, and return them using the callback supplied.
                public void retrieve(Query query, RetrieveCallback callback, URN[] urnsToNotRetrieve) throws DatabaseServiceException {
                                        //some basic error handling
                                        if(!fasta.exists()) {
                        throw new DatabaseServiceException("Fasta file does not exist (file name="+fasta+")",false);
                    }

                    try{
                                                BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(fasta));
                                                String currentLine = "";
                                                String name = "";
                                                String residues = "";
                        ArrayList nameToMatch = new ArrayList();
                                                ArrayList residuesToMatch = new ArrayList();
                        boolean matchEverything = false; //this is true if we want both the name and the residues to match for a document to be included in the seaarch results

                        //we will store a list of the queries
                        java.util.List queries;

                        //a compoundSearchQuery consists of a number of queries
                        //we'll put them in the list
                        if(query instanceof CompoundSearchQuery){
                            CompoundSearchQuery cQuery = (CompoundSearchQuery)query;
                            matchEverything = cQuery.getOperator() == CompoundSearchQuery.Operator.AND;
                            queries = (java.util.List) cQuery.getChildren();
                        }
                        //if the query is not a CompoundSearchQuery, then we can create a one-element list containing the query
                        else {
                            queries = new ArrayList();
                            queries.add(query);
                        }

                        //we'll loop through all the queries, and set the nameToMatch and residuesToMatch
                        for(Query q : queries){
                            //we have the sequence and name, do the searching
                            if(q instanceof AdvancedSearchQueryTerm){
                                AdvancedSearchQueryTerm advancedQuery = (AdvancedSearchQueryTerm)q;
                                if(advancedQuery.getField().getCode().equals("name")){
                                    nameToMatch.add(advancedQuery.getValues()[0].toString().toUpperCase());
                                }
                                else if(advancedQuery.getField().getCode().equals("residues")){
                                    residuesToMatch.add(advancedQuery.getValues()[0].toString().toUpperCase());
                                }
                            }

                            //a BasicSearchQuery consists of one field (search text)
                            //you can extend a basic query, for example using a CompoundSearchQuery
                            else if (q instanceof BasicSearchQuery) {
                                //set both the name and the residue searches to the query entered
                                BasicSearchQuery bq = (BasicSearchQuery)query;
                                nameToMatch.add(bq.getSearchText().toUpperCase());
                                residuesToMatch.add(bq.getSearchText().toUpperCase());
                            }
                            else{
                                //do nothing
                            }
                        }

                        //if neither nameToMatch or residuesToMatch are set at this point, the search will return no results.

                        //now lets loop through the fasta file
                        while((currentLine = in.readLine()) != null){

                            //fasta files consist of 'name' lines (denoted by a beginning '>' character), and then a number of 'residue' lines
                            if(currentLine.startsWith(">")){
                                                                if(!name.equals("")){
                                    //we get to this part of the code once we have read in one sequence (a name line and the residue lines)
                                    //so we must now do a match on the name and residues that we have read in
                                    SequenceDocument doc = match(nameToMatch,name,residuesToMatch,residues, matchEverything);
                                    if(doc != null){
                                        //add a search result if there is one
                                        callback.add(doc, Collections.emptyMap());
                                    }

                                }

                                //set the name variable to the new sequence name, and reset the residues variable
                                name = currentLine.substring(1,currentLine.length());
                                                                residues = "";
                                                        }
                                                        else{
                                //keep concatenating the residues as we move through the fasta file
                                residues += currentLine;
                                                        }
                                                }
                        //we need to do the match one last time once we reach the end of the file
                        SequenceDocument doc = match(nameToMatch,name,residuesToMatch,residues, matchEverything);
                        if(doc != null){
                            callback.add(doc, Collections.emptyMap());
                        }
                    }
                                        catch(IOException e){
                        //pass on any exceptions we get reading the file
                        throw new DatabaseServiceException(e,e.getMessage(),false);
                                        }
                                }

                //this utility method returns a SequenceDocument based on the given name and residues, if they match the search parameters
                //or null if there is no match
                private SequenceDocument match(ArrayList namesToMatch, String name, ArrayList residuesToMatch, String residues, boolean matchBoth){
                    boolean nameMatch = namesToMatch.size() == 0;
                    boolean residueMatch = residuesToMatch.size() == 0;
                    if(namesToMatch.size() > 0){
                        nameMatch = matchBoth;
                        for(String nameToMatch : namesToMatch){
                            if(name.toUpperCase().contains(nameToMatch) == !matchBoth){
                                nameMatch = !matchBoth;
                            }
                        }
                    }

                    if(residuesToMatch.size() > 0){
                        residueMatch = matchBoth;
                        for(String residueToMatch : residuesToMatch){
                            if(residues.toUpperCase().contains(residueToMatch) == !matchBoth){
                                residueMatch = !matchBoth;
                            }
                        }
                    }

                    if(residueMatch && nameMatch){
                        return new DefaultNucleotideSequence(name.substring(0,name.indexOf(" ")),name,residues,new Date(fasta.lastModified()));
                    }
                    return null;
                }
            }
                };

    • Constructor Detail

      • GeneiousService

    • Method Detail

      • getUniqueID

        public abstract String getUniqueID()
        Get a unique identifier for this GeneiousService. This is so that PluginUtilities.getGeneiousService(String) String)} can be used to find this GeneiousService and so that agents can find the service each time Geneious is run. Hence the unique id for a service should never change. It cannot be null. A unique identifier may consist of any valid Java identifier characters (see Character.isJavaIdentifierPart(char) as well as the space character.

        Warning: Changing the unique ID may imply breaking backward compatibility with existing documents in the local database. If in doubt, using Object.getClass().getName() is a reasonable unique ID as long as the class name does not change.

        Returns:
        a unique identifier for this GeneiousService.

      • getName

        public abstract String getName()
        This gives the human-readable name of the service as it might appear in any user-interface. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        service name.

      • getServiceTreeLabel

        public String getServiceTreeLabel(boolean expanded,
                         boolean showAdditionalInformation)
        Provide additional details for a human user. Text returned here is displayed as the label in the service tree.

        For example, a service may include additional information such as number of documents in a service, which may change over time. Any implementation of this method must return quickly. For example it should not wait on network I/O before returning.

        Parameters:
        showAdditionalInformation - if true, then optionally add extra information, such as the number of documents contained within the service
        expanded - if the service's children are visible in the tree.
        Returns:
        service tree text or null to indicate caller should use getName()

      • getDescription

        public abstract String getDescription()
        This gives the human-readable short description of the service as it might appear in any user-interface. (example - tooltip). Cannot be null
        Returns:
        service description.

      • getFullPath

        public final String getFullPath()
        Gives you the full path to this service as it appears in the Geneious service tree. This is built by concatenating getServiceTreeLabel(true,false) (or getName() if getServiceTreeLabel returns null) of all the ancestor services (excluding the root service) and this service together with '/' separators.
        Returns:
        the full path to this service.

      • getHelp

        public abstract String getHelp()
        Help text. (example: when you press F1 when service is selected, or inside the help panel)
        Returns:
        help text.

      • getIcons

        public abstract Icons getIcons()
        Icons used in the service list. If null then the default folder icon will be used.
        Returns:
        Icons for service.

      • getActionsAlwaysEnabled

        public List<GeneiousAction> getActionsAlwaysEnabled()
        a list of Geneious Actions which can appear in the menu bar, toolbar or popup-menu in the service tree.
        Returns:
        actions list.

        This can be empty, but not null. These actions are enabled always and may be selected by the user when another service is selected. Popup actions may be returned here or in getActionsEnabledWhenServiceSelected().

        If an action has been setEnabled(false) (non-default) then the action will always be disabled in Geneious.

      • getActionsEnabledWhenServiceSelected

        public List<GeneiousAction> getActionsEnabledWhenServiceSelected()
        List of Geneious Actions which can appear in the menu bar, toolbar or popup-menu in the service tree.

        This can be empty (e.g. Collections.emptyList()), but not null. These actions are only enabled when this service is selected. If many services provide actions of the same name from this method then they will be placed under a single menu item/button and the action of that menu item/button is dependent on the selected service. This does not count for popup actions because these are only visible when the service itself is right-clicked (Ctrl+Click on MacOS).

        Returns:
        list of actions that should be enabled when this service is selected.

      • initialize

        protected void initialize(GeneiousServiceListener listener)
        Constructor method - initializes the service. Any service that needs to create child services, or change its status from ServiceStatus.AVAILABLE, or change its name or icon needs to override this method, and call appropriate methods on the listener parameter.

        If this is not a WritableDatabaseService this method is called first thing after creating the service using a parameterless constructor.

        If this is a WritableDatabaseService, methods that deal with hidden folders and hidden elements may be called before initialize. These include WritableDatabaseService.getHiddenElementNames(), WritableDatabaseService.getHiddenFolder(String, boolean) and WritableDatabaseService.getHiddenElement(String, jebl.util.ProgressListener).

        External classes should not call this method. They should instead use initializeService(GeneiousServiceListener) which sets up internal handlers and calls this method. Even then, generally only the Geneious application itself should be calling initializeService(GeneiousServiceListener).

        Parameters:
        listener - a listener for reporting changes to the service, such as status changes or new child services.

      • getStatus

        public GeneiousService.ServiceStatus getStatus(boolean returnUnavailableIfLicensePreventsUsage)
        Gets the status of this service. For any service that has not yet set its status, this returns GeneiousService.ServiceStatus.UNAVAILABLE while it hasn't been initialized, and GeneiousService.ServiceStatus.AVAILABLE once it has finished initializing (by returning from initializeService(GeneiousServiceListener))

        Note that there is no isInitialized() method, but you can get a similar result by checking that getStatus() equals GeneiousService.ServiceStatus.AVAILABLE.
        Parameters:
        returnUnavailableIfLicensePreventsUsage - true to return GeneiousService.ServiceStatus.UNAVAILABLE no matter what the real status of this service is if it is a restricted service and the user doesn't have an active license.
        Returns:
        the current status of this server.
        See Also:
        addGeneiousServiceListener(GeneiousServiceListener), GeneiousServiceListener.statusChanged(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.GeneiousService.ServiceStatus)

      • initializeService

        public final void initializeService(GeneiousServiceListener listener)
        Initializes this service by setting up internal handlers and delegating to initialize(GeneiousServiceListener).

        Generally only the Geneious application itself should be calling this method.

        Parameters:
        listener - a listener for reporting changes to the service, such as status changes or new child services.

      • getGeneiousServiceListener

        protected GeneiousServiceListener getGeneiousServiceListener()
        Get the service passed to the initialize(GeneiousServiceListener) method. This method exists primarily so super/sub-classes have access to the listener
        Returns:
        the service passed to the initialize(GeneiousServiceListener) method.

      • getChildServices

        public final List<GeneiousService> getChildServices()
        Provides a list of all the current children of this service. If you want to be notified when the children change, use addGeneiousServiceListener(GeneiousServiceListener)
        Subclassing note: This method is final. If a service wishes to provide child services, it should add/remove then using the listener passed to the initialize method.
        Returns:
        a list of all the current children of this service.

      • getParentService

        public final GeneiousService getParentService()
        Get the parent service of this service or null if this service has no parent (it is the root service). There is a single root service for all services which is invisible in the user interface. This method also returns null if this service has not yet been added as a child service of another service (using GeneiousServiceListener.childServiceAdded(GeneiousService) or if it has been removed from its parent service (using GeneiousServiceListener.childServiceRemoved(GeneiousService)
        Returns:
        the parent service of this service or null if this service has no parent.

      • addGeneiousServiceListener

        public final void addGeneiousServiceListener(GeneiousServiceListener listener)
        Add a listener to be notified about changes to this service.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be notified.

      • addWeakGeneiousServiceListener

        public final void addWeakGeneiousServiceListener(GeneiousServiceListener listener)
        Add a weakly referenced listener to be notified about changes to this service.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be notified.
        Since:
        API 4.600 (Geneious 6.0.0)

      • removeGeneiousServiceListener

        public final void removeGeneiousServiceListener(GeneiousServiceListener listener)
        Remove a listener to be notified about changes to this service.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener previously added using addGeneiousServiceListener(GeneiousServiceListener)

      • canShutdown

        public boolean canShutdown()
        This is called to check whether the system can close. This may involve asking the user to save results etc. Any actual cleaning up should be done in shutdown() because if any service vetoes the close, the service may have to continue. If false is returned from this method then a message should be displayed to the user explaining the reason for denying shutdown.
        Returns:
        true to allow close, false to deny.

      • shutdown

        public final void shutdown()
        This method is called Geneious is shutting down or the plugin that provided this service is being disabled.

        The service can perform any necessary clean up actions. This is only called after all services have agreed to the close request by returning true from canShutdown(). This method delegates to the implementation method _shutdown(). This method will not return until the shutdown has completed. This method may be called from multiple threads, in which case only a single call is made to _shutdown() and no calls to this method will return until the call to _shutdown() has completed.

        See Also:
        canShutdown(), _shutdown(), hasShutdownOrStartedShuttingDown()

      • _shutdown

        protected void _shutdown()
        The implementation method for shutdown(). Any subclass that wants to take special action when shutdown is called should override this method.
        See Also:
        shutdown(), hasShutdownOrStartedShuttingDown()

      • hasShutdownOrStartedShuttingDown

        public final boolean hasShutdownOrStartedShuttingDown()
        Returns true if this service or its parent service has been shutdown() or if it is in the process of shutting down.
        Returns:
        true if this service or its parent service has been shutdown or if it is in the process of shutting down.
        See Also:
        shutdown()

      • getPreferences

        public GeneiousPreferences getPreferences()
        Deprecated. use GeneiousPlugin.getPluginPreferences() instead
        Override this function to provide service preferences.
        Returns:
        service preferences. Can be null.

      • isProOnly

        public boolean isProOnly()
        This function returns true if the service requires an active license.
        Returns:
        true if the service requires an active license

      • showInServiceTree

        public boolean showInServiceTree()
        Override and return false to hide this service from the service tree. Default returns true. If a service wishes to change the result of this method after initializing, it should fire a GeneiousServiceListener.serviceTreeLabelChanged()
        Returns:
        whether or not this service should appear in the service tree

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        A string representation of this GeneiousService. Note: This may change at any time, so do not rely on the format of the toString() String for anything.
